revised_title: A Description of the Portsmouth Earthquake of 1749-50
tldr: The author, Mr. Taylor, describes an earthquake experienced in Portsmouth on March 18, 1749-50. The earthquake was felt in nearby locations such as Havant, Fitchfield, Guernsey, and Jersey. The shaking was accompanied by a noise similar to distant thunder and lasted about 4-5 seconds. The author speculates that the earthquake's energy may have been absorbed by the sea floor, reducing the risk of damage on land.
